page.title: 15FARMING -ST.BRIAVELS COMMON
page.content: St.Briavels Common today has four farms of over 100 acres,three are Dairy and one is Sheep and Beef.There are many smallholdings and cottages. The Hudnalls Farm is owned by Mr. and Mrs.John Bennett.They have one hundred acres of land,six acres is permanent grass,two acres is woodland and the rest is used for grass,sillage or growing turnips.They keep about fifty-five Friesian milking cows and a few sheep and beef cattle.The refrige- rated milk tanker collects their milk and takes it to the creamery in Stone- house. Thirty years ago they employed four men but now Mr.and Mrs.Bennett and their son work the farm themsel- ves.They have added twenty acres to their land in that time, but do not expect to expand any further.
